column5: It's been a while since I posted a report.  I've been out a few times this year, but havne't taken any pictures.  I had a week off work and me and my little one decided to make it a cottage/fishing adventure!  I answered ecmilley's offer for renting his cottage on Sturgeon Lake and we stayed there last Wednesday and Thursday night.  It's a GREAT place to stay that's right on the water and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a place on that lake.  We arrived Wednesday around noon and unpacked our gear...this is the view from the front porch....   We wasted very little time as she wanted to get out to fish!  We first headed to the government dock, which is just a few steps away from his cottage.  She caught dozens and dozens or nice little panfish here.   She's finally at that age where she can bait her own hook and take her fish off as well!   We decided to take a break from fishing and we went to a little beach area to cool off from the hot sun.   After catching fish after fish here, we decided to drive down to Big Cliff's place for a visit and to fish from his docks.  We were treated to lots of big panfish and an amazing sunset.  Here she is with a bass she caught on a spinner.   Here's one I caught (yes I did catch a fish or two as well...but she beat me hands down for numbers!)   As the sun went down in the sky, she said "WHOA!! Daddy!! Look at that!!!"   A few shots as the sun finally set...     On Thursday, we got up...had a little breakfast and we decided to rent a boat to see what we could find.  I didn't care about what we caught...as long as she had a great time and into some numbers!  We were out there for over 4 hours before the sun got too hot and we came in for the day.  She is loving using spinners to catch fish...here's a few of her fish from the boat.      We stopped in at Big Cliff's dock again to stretch our legs...and yep...she wanted to fish there again!   After we ate dinner, she wanted to catch a few more at the government docks...here we are with one of our many double headers for the evening.   If you are looking to take your little one somewhere where the panfishing is constant, I'd definitely suggest Sturgeon Lake...it seems that you can always find where they are hanging out...bring lots of worms though!! You'll need them!  We packed the car on Friday morning, but left the rods out for last. (before anyone says anything...that is HER tackle box...not mine!! LOL).  She wanted to fish a little more before we hit the road for home.      Part two coming up...
Dude that is the best report I have seen in a long time. I have 2 girls a 2 year old and a 4 year old and I can't wait for these times.  Thanks for the smile.
wow the smiles on you both tells it all!  Cheers!
Nice going guys.  Good to see you getting back out and posting
Nice!! My two girls love fishing for panfish and my oldest wants to come out with me for pickereyes one evening. Fun times!!
Truly great to see Cliff. Glad you two had a good time!
Nice to see a report from you Cliff! Looks like a great time.
I am happy you had a great time Cliff, I was busy with work unable to meet up and say hi, your welcome back anytime
Great stuff, ccmt....can't beat quality time like that.  You have a seriousl little fishergirl on your hands there!
Thanks for the two reports Cliff. Good times and nice to see some reports from you.
Great report Cliff. Nice to read and see.
Haven't seen you around for a while Cliff. Enjoyed the report!

We were lucky enough to meet Sydney at Lakair last month, Cliff. She took a real shine to our dog, Moosy. You couldn't meet a nicer, more polite young lady.  Looks like you guys know what vacation is all about...
Thanks for the comments everyone!  We had a great time.  Ecmilley...the cottage was great and close to everything we needed. My little one is a fishing machine when she puts her mind to it!
